#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk glib2
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: glib2 bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: GLib provides the core application building blocks for libraries and applications written in C. It provides the core object system used in GNOME, the main loop implementation, and a large set of utility functions for strings and common data structures. The glib2 packages have been upgraded to upstream version 2.40, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. This upgrade also includes a patch which removes a warning message emitted by upstream version 2.40 when malfunctioning applications attempt to remove a non-existent event source. (BZ#1104372, BZ#1132624) This update also fixes the following bug: A change in the glib2 implementation of child process monitoring could trigger behavior changes in programs that used the g_spawn_sync() function and their own SIGCHLD handler or that incorrectly called the g_spawn_async() function. This update restores the behavior so that GLib only installs a SIGCHLD handler for g_spawn_async() calls. However, applications should still ensure that the G_SPAWN_DO_NOT_REAP_CHILD flag is specified if g_spawn_async() is used with the g_child_watch_add() function. (BZ#1092044) Users of glib2 are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
